Module lanat
Package lanat.parsing.errors

Interface Error<C extends ErrorContext>

Type Parameters:
C - the type of the error context
All Superinterfaces:
ErrorLevelProvider
All Known Subinterfaces:
Error.ParseError, Error.TokenizeError
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArgumentTypeError, ParseErrors.IncorrectUsagesCountError, ParseErrors.IncorrectValueNumberError, ParseErrors.MultipleArgsInRestrictedGroupUsedError, ParseErrors.RequiredArgumentNotUsedError, ParseErrors.SimilarArgumentError, ParseErrors.UniqueArgumentUsedError, ParseErrors.UnmatchedInArgNameListError, ParseErrors.UnmatchedTokenError, SimpleError, TokenizeErrors.SpaceRequiredError, TokenizeErrors.StringNotClosedError, TokenizeErrors.TupleAlreadyOpenError, TokenizeErrors.TupleNotClosedError, TokenizeErrors.UnexpectedTupleCloseError
public sealed interface Error<C extends ErrorContext> extends ErrorLevelProvider permits Error.ParseError, Error.TokenizeError
An error that indicates a failure in the parsing process.

  • Method Details

    • handle

      void handle(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorFormattingContext fmt, @NotNull C ctx)
      Formats the error message to be displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      fmt - The error formatting context.
      ctx - The error context, which may provide useful methods to get more data about the error.

    • getErrorLevel

      @NotNull default @NotNull ErrorLevel getErrorLevel()
      Returns the error level of the error. This is used to determine whether the error should be displayed to the user, depending on the error level set in the configuration of the commands.
      By default, this method returns ErrorLevel.ERROR.
      Specified by:
      getErrorLevel in interface ErrorLevelProvider
      Returns:
      The error level of the error.

    • shouldRemoveOther

      default boolean shouldRemoveOther(@NotNull @NotNull Error<?> other)
      Determine whether this error should remove the other error from the list of errors. Only errors of the same command are compared.

      This method is invoked for each error in the list of errors, and the error is removed if this method returns true.

      Parameters:
      other - the other error
      Returns:
      whether this error should remove the other error. By default, this method returns false.
